Description: Tondo and stem sherd of Attic black-figured pottery little-master cup; interior: in tondo, two male figures courting (thighs, erect penis, left elbow, and right arm and hand reaching of man on left; thigh, part of buttock, and erect penis of man on right); traces of added red on genitals and buttock; inscription in between figures; exterior glazed black; underside reserved.
Producer name: Attributed to: The Phrynos Painter (possibly (von Bothmer))
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
According to Venit (quoting von Bothmer's opinion), the sherd may be attributed to the Phrynos Painter.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 420, no. B657)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0586) (Phase 1)
